Class AbstractWorker

java.lang.Object
net.greghaines.jesque.worker.AbstractWorker
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, JobExecutor, Worker
Direct Known Subclasses:
WorkerImpl, WorkerPoolImpl
public abstract class AbstractWorker extends Object implements Worker
AbstractWorker extracts common behavior for the concrete worker implementations.

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts this worker. Registers the worker in Redis and begins polling the queues for jobs.
      Stop this worker by calling end() on any thread.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • end

      public void end(boolean now)
      Shutdown this Worker.
      The worker cannot be started again; create a new worker in this case.
      Specified by:
      end in interface JobExecutor
      Parameters:
      now - if true, an effort will be made to stop any job in progress

      Description copied from interface: Worker
      Returns whether this worker is paused.
      Specified by:
      isPaused in interface Worker
      Returns:
      whether this worker is paused. If true, the worker is not processing any new jobs; if false, the worker is processing new jobs

    • addQueue

      public void addQueue(String queueName)
      Description copied from interface: Worker
      Poll the given queue. If the queue exists multiple times, it will be checked that many times per loop. This allows for a queue to be given higher priority by checking it more often.
      Specified by:
      addQueue in interface Worker
      Parameters:
      queueName - the name of the queue to poll

    • removeQueue

      public void removeQueue(String queueName, boolean all)
      Description copied from interface: Worker
      Stop polling the given queue. If the all argument is true, all instances of the queue will be removed, otherwise, only one instance is removed.
      Specified by:
      removeQueue in interface Worker
      Parameters:
      queueName - the queue to stop polling
      all - whether to remove all or only one of the instances

    • join

      public void join(long millis) throws InterruptedException
      Description copied from interface: JobExecutor
      Wait for this JobExecutor to complete. A timeout of 0 means to wait forever. This method will only return after a thread has called JobExecutor.end(boolean).
      Specified by:
      join in interface JobExecutor
      Parameters:
      millis - the time to wait in milliseconds
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if any thread has interrupted the current thread

      protected Object execute(Job job, String curQueue, Object instance) throws Exception
      Executes the given job.
      Parameters:
      job - the job to execute
      curQueue - the queue the job came from
      instance - the materialized job
      Returns:
      result of the execution
      Throws:
      Exception - if the instance is a Callable and throws an exception

      runner - the materialized Job
      result - the result of the successful execution of the Job
      curQueue - the queue the Job came from

      protected String failMsg(Throwable thrwbl, String queue, Job job) throws IOException
      Create and serialize a JobFailure.
      Parameters:
      thrwbl - the Throwable that occurred
      queue - the queue the job came from
      job - the Job that failed
      Returns:
      the JSON representation of a new JobFailure
      Throws:
      IOException - if there was an error serializing the JobFailure
